  • Method Details

    • get

      T get(Location loc)
      Get the contents of the cell in the given x,y location.

      y must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than getHeight(). x must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than getWidth().

      Parameters:
      loc - The (x,y) position of the grid cell to get the contents of.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if !isOnGrid(loc)

    • getOrDefault

      default T getOrDefault(Location pos, T defaultResult)
      Get the contents of the cell in the given x,y location.

      y must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than getHeight(). x must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than getWidth().

      Parameters:
      pos - The (x,y) position of the grid cell to get the contents of.
      defaultResult - A default value to be substituted if the (x,y) is out of bounds or contents == null.

    • set

      void set(Location pos, T element)
      Set the contents of the cell in the given x,y location.

      y must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than getHeight(). x must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than getWidth().

      Parameters:
      pos - The (x,y) position of the grid cell to get the contents of.
      element - The contents the cell is to have.
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if !isOnGrid(pos)

    • numRows

      int numRows()
      Returns:
      The height of the grid.

    • numColumns

      int numColumns()
      Returns:
      The width of the grid.

    • fill

      void fill(Function<Location,T> initialiser)
      Initialise the contents of all cells using an initialiser function.

      The function will be called with the (x,y) position of an element, and is expected to return the element to place at that position. For example: 

       // fill all cells with the position as a string (e.g., "(2,2)")
 grid.setAll((x, y) -> String.format("(%d,%d)", x, y));
      Parameters:
      initialiser - The initialiser function

    • fill

      void fill(T element)
      Set the contents of all cells to element

      For example: 

       // clear the grid
 grid.setAll(null);
      Parameters:
      initialiser -

    • copy

      IGrid<T> copy()
      Make a copy
      Returns:
      A fresh copy of the grid, with the same elements

    • isOnGrid

      boolean isOnGrid(Location pos)
      Check if coordinates are valid.

      Valid coordinates are 0 invalid input: '<'= pos.getX() invalid input: '<' getWidth(), 0 invalid input: '<'= pos.getY() invalid input: '<' getHeight().

      Parameters:
      pos - A position
      Returns:
      true if the position is within the grid

    • locations

      Iterable<Location> locations()
      Iterate over all grid locations

      See also Iterable.iterator() â€“ using the grid directly in a for-loop will iterate over the elements.

      All locations obtained through the iterator are guaranteed to be valid according to

      invalid reference 
      #isValid(ILocation)
      .
      Returns:
      An iterable for iterating over all the locations in the grid

    • getNeighbourhood

      List<Location> getNeighbourhood(Location loc)
      Get the adjacent 8 cells to the given location loc
      Parameters:
      loc -
      Returns:
      list of neighbouring cells.

    • getNeighbourhood

      List<Location> getNeighbourhood(Location loc, int dist)
      Get all adjacent cells to the given location loc with distance dist.
      Parameters:
      loc -
      Returns:
      list of neighbouring cells given distance
